item.description:
Hi everyone!

MIT holds a Japanese Lunch Table every week right next to the Kendall/MIT subway stop on the red line.

What is Lunch Table?
The goal of Lunch Table is to bring together people that would like to chat in either English or Japanese with other members of the local community. The format is very casual - please bring yourself, a lunch (if you would like), and a desire to chat.

When is Lunch Table?
Every Wednesday, from 12:30 - 2:00 PM.

Where is Lunch Table?
MIT's Building E38, in the 7th floor conference room.

Here are the directions:

1) Take the Red Line T to MIT/Kendall Station
2) Look for Building E38, right next to the large Red Line INBOUND Entrance. You will see a sign for the MIT Press Bookstore on the outside of the building.
3) Enter the building through two sets of doors, and take the elevator on your right up to the 6th floor.
4) After exiting the elevator on the 6th floor, take the stairs up to the 7th floor and turn right
5) The conference room will be in front of you.

Here's a map indicating the location of building E38:

http://web.mit.edu/~r...

Here's a web page showing a small image of building E38 (image is taken from near the Outbound Entrance):

http://whereis.mit.ed...

We are invited guests of MIT Lunch Table, so please remember to be courteous and listen to the requests of both Nagatomi-san and Reichert-san (the organizers of Lunch Table).

Hope to see many of you there!
item.name: MIT Lunch Table
